Entities.Name: Protein
Entities.Definition: Biological molecules consisting of one or more long chains of amino acid residues, which are vital parts of living organisms.

Sample Data.Sentence: Albumin levels were detected in the patient's blood sample.

Entities.Name: DNA
Entities.Definition: A molecule composed of two long chains of nucleotides twisted around each other, forming a double helix carrying genetic instructions.

Sample Data.Sentence: DNA sequencing was performed to identify the genetic mutation.

Entities.Name: RNA
Entities.Definition: Nucleic acid involved in protein synthesis and sometimes in the transmission of genetic information.

Sample Data.Sentence: Messenger RNA levels were quantified to assess gene expression.

Entities.Name: Cell Line
Entities.Definition: Cells that are cultured in vitro and can be propagated indefinitely as a stable cell line.

Sample Data.Sentence: HeLa cell lines were used for the cancer research experiments.

Entities.Name: Cell Type
Entities.Definition: Specific and distinguishable types of cells within a multicellular organism or within a tissue or organ.

Sample Data.Sentence: T-lymphocytes are a type of white blood cell involved in immune response.

Dataset.Name: JNLPBA and NCBI-Disease datasets
Dataset.Details: Datasets used for model validation include JNLPBA, consisting of sentences from biomedical literature, and NCBI-Disease, focusing on disease mentions in abstracts.

Annotation Guidelines.Description: The annotation process involves identifying specific named entities in biomedical text, categorizing them into predefined classes such as Protein, DNA, RNA, Cell Line, and Cell Type, using deep learning models enhanced by CNN and LSTM architectures.
